Author: dfranke
Content: I'm nowhere near MM's level in poker, but I'll chime in since he hasn't yet.  The value of ability to read tells is vastly inflated in the public consciousness.  Some bad players have very obvious ones, but at higher levels it just doesn't happen much that anybody picks up anybody else's tells.  You read other players by how they bet, not by which way they twitch.  Good poker players are good at picking out patterns by induction.
